title.native: ソードアート・オンライン アリシゼーション War of Underworld
title.romaji: Sword Art Online: Alicization - War of Underworld
title.english: Sword Art Online: Alicization - War of Underworld

description:
Kirito, Eugeo, and Alice. Six months have passed since the two disciples and an Integrity Knight brought down the pontifex, Administrator. With the fighting over, Alice has been living in her hometown of Rulid Village. Beside her is Kirito, who has not only lost his arm and soul, but also his dear friend. As Alice devotes herself to looking after Kirito, she too has lost the will to fight she once had as a knight.

Nevertheless, the time for the final stress test – one which will engulf the entire Underworld with tragedy – draws relentlessly closer.

Meanwhile, in the deepest areas of the Dark Territory, the Dark God Vecta has resurrected, as if to have waited for this very moment. Leading an army of dark forces, they begin their invasion into the human empire in hopes of attaining the Priestess of Light. The human empire force led by the Integrity Knight Bercouli prepares for a war of an unimaginable scale against the army of the Dark Territory. Even then, Alice is nowhere to be seen, nor the two heroes that saved the realm...

(Source: Official Website)

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Goblin
tags.description: A goblin is a monstrous creature from European folklore. They are almost always small and grotesque, mischievous or outright malicious, and greedy. Sometimes with magical abilities.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
__Current Residence:__ Nerima, Tokyo, Japan
__Doujin Circle:__ WordGear

Kawahara Reki graduated from the Aoyama Gakuin University.

[Official Website](http://wordgear.sblo.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kunori)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/133216962)

[Official website](http://bunplusbun.sakura.ne.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bunbun922) | [Blog (abec)](http://abec.blog93.fc2.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bunbun_plus) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/8142) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/BUNBUN922)

His older sister is [Yukiko Horiguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/102497/Yukiko-Horiguchi).

Major illustration works: 
- Kare Kanojo and Summon Magic (カレとカノジョと召喚魔法)
- Mary Rose (薔薇のマリア) - We AI (僕らA.I) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica Black Series (神曲奏界ポリフォニカ ブラック・シリーズ) 
- Girl with Radio Jamming (ラジオガール・ウィズ・ジャミング) 
- Zoahanta (ゾアハンター) (with Junichi Osako, author of Polyphonica Black) 
- Asuka 
- Garouden Mahjon - (アスカ -麻雀餓狼伝-) 
- All Death War (全死大戦)  

Other works: 
- Illustrations BUNBUN (illustration collection) 
- Rondo of Swords (DS game - character designs) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonia THE BLACK (PC Game / Kinetic Novel - character designs).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomoya_nishi)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sagimorilanes)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/p1b9f44vegyae8n)

Affiliated with [Dangun Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6521/). Initially worked as a production assistant.

His work on the 34th episode of [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/11061/) attracted a lot of attention within the industry, as well as his more recent work in [Sword Art Online: Alicization](https://anilist.co/anime/100182/), in which he mostly teamed-up with [Kentarou Waki](https://anilist.co/staff/146156/).
Animator and character designer affiliated with A-1 Pictures.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3070697778)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kiminori114514) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/66126678)

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
**Morioka Kenichi** is a Japanese art and set designer, who also does design work.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/133216962)
Affiliated with REAL-T.
Animator and character designer affiliated with A-1 Pictures.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YuhoTaniuchi)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)

__Height:__ 165 cm

[Website](https://www.tomatsuharuka.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/tomatsuharuka-blog)

Tomatsu debuted in 2007, starring in Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica as Corticarte Apa Lagranges. Since then, she has had other major roles such as Lala Satalin Deviluke in To Love-Ru and Shiho Sannomiya in Zettai Karen Children. Before graduating from high school in 2008, she used to live in Ichimomiya city where she often took the shinkansen, traveling back and forth between Nagoya and Tokyo to attend recordings. On January 11, 2019, she married a man from outside the entertainment industry.

One of the members of the voice actress unit [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Mary - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Twitter](https://x.com/naomi_nakano_8?t=du26TQSGyB-QUe8z-Iaqsg&s=09) | [Stella](https://stella-quartz.jp/)

Founder and president of Stella.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/82925448) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/1406247)
